title: Émile Vadboncoeur
text:
I’m Émile Vadboncoeur, a PhD candidate at Carleton University. I study thermal biology and how it interacts in multi-stressor context.

title: Thermal preference machine
text: I am currently building a machine to automatically follow crickets along a thermal gradient. This will save a lot of measuring time and allow for the data to be treated directly in R.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text: This is the first post to my blog. Welcome! Sophie Kasdorf and I have been talking about getting a website to represent us online. Here is mine! The picture is use working on those sites at Olies on campus.

title: About
text: I’m Émile Vadboncoeur, a PhD candidate in Biology at Carleton University (Ottawa, Canada). My research focuses on insect physiology and performance, with an emphasis on how temperature and nutrition shape growth, development, metabolism, and survival. I combine controlled rearing experiments with modelling approaches (e.g., growth curves and thermal performance curves) to connect individual physiology to production outcomes and broader questions in animal performance biology.
